intro: Centenaria rupacquiana, commonly known as the desert milkweed, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring and summer. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water. Centenaria rupacquiana plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
